headline: Honey-Garlic Slow Cooker Chicken Thighs
description: These crock pot chicken thighs are tender and delicious. The sweet and savory sauce is easy to prep with soy sauce, ketchup, garlic, and honey.

video.description: Easy recipe for tender, sweet and savory chicken thighs.
video.name: Honey-Garlic Slow Cooker Chicken Thighs

name: Honey-Garlic Slow Cooker Chicken Thighs

recipeInstructions.text: Arrange chicken thighs in a single layer in the bottom of a 4-quart slow cooker.
Whisk soy sauce, ketchup, honey, garlic, and basil together in a bowl; pour over chicken thighs.
Cover and cook on Low for 6 hours or High for 3 to 4 hours.

review.reviewBody: Excellent! Topped it off with sesame seeds, chopped scallions & orange zest!
Used L/S shoyu, no basil. Came out flavorful and juicy but should’ve added small can of pineapple chunks in natural juice to give a tang. Definitely needs to be broiled to give the top that crust.

I tried this recipe tonight, only took about 1 hr and 45 min in my crockpot. I'm in love, the taste is amazing. I read through the other comments, I'm not big on salt and it tasted great to me. I also used low sodium soy sauce.

Followed the recipe exactly. Turned out way too salty. Also cooked for 4 hours on high, which was too much time... some of the pieces were overcooked as a result. 3 hrs is probably plenty of time on high. Would be better maybe with a very low salt soy sauce?

I saw this crispy yummy looking chicken and I thought wow. But I kept looking at mine in the slow cooker and it was looking like boiled chicken pale? I don't know what everybody else did different than me. So now I've transferred mine into my air fryer hoping to make it look more appealing. So far as the taste I don't have an opinion on that yet... To be continued...
Easy and delicious!
It was delicious. I didn't change anything. I will be fixing this again
This recipe is tastier than I thought it would be. It is super simple and super reliable.

I loved this recipe. It was very quick and easy to make. I always use low sodium soy sauce but maybe ppl need to try tomato puree instead ketchup to cut the salt out ?? Btw I didn't find it that salty but it personal taste :)
After reading some comments I thought it would be too salty but it wasn't. I used low sodium soy sauce and I always use low sodium ketchup. It was delicious!
So easy and delicious, will definitely make this again!
Made just as directed and served over steamed rice - My husband loved it!

Followed the recipe exactly and it was not good. The sauce was overpowering and too salty. It also looked nothing like the picture. I do think that bone-in thighs would be better and either more chicken or less sauce.
I didn't have any basil but no one seemed to have anything negative to say. I have two denture wearers and they loved it. No problem with meat being too tough to eat! It was perfect!

Allrecipes, is it too much to ask you get your acts together (literally?) The recipe says four thighs, but the accompanying video shows at least six in the pot (for the same amount of sauce.) Is it supposed to be 3-4 hours on low, or (as in the video) 3-4 hours on high if you're "short on time"? Or, since one reviewer said bone-IN thighs were ready after only four hours on low, is it neither? And while the photo looks delicious, I am really skeptical that you got a brown crust like that without giving the chicken a quick broil in the oven.

I agree with some of the other raters. Even with lower sodium soy sauce, this was too salty for me and not the best flavor. I added chopped green peppers & onions, but couldn't even tell they were in there given the stong salt flavor. Adding ginger might have counter acted it. It was OK, but not great.

Made this exactually as written. Used Gluten free soy sauce (which I think is low sodium) and it turned out great. Served over rice Also used bone in thighs It was ready in 4 hours on low. Substituted oregano for basil because I didn't have any basil. This will become a regular. Saved the sauce and will use for chicken breasts. Can't wait.
Very good! Served it over brown rice with a salad & sautéed spinach. I wish the sauce was a bit thicker. Quick & easy though.
Incredibly delicious!! SO good. My hubby and 3 year old ate it all up. That's saying a lot, because the little one is extremely picky. This will be a weekly dinner!!
The taste was amazing. Cleanup is simple and easy to make.

I used low sodium soy sauce and it was very tasty, not too salty. I also used bone in thighs. They took about 6 hrs on low for 6 thighs. They fell off the bone and put the chicken and sauce over rice, perfect.
i thnik it is good
Very good!!! I used 8 thighs and doubled the recipe, cooked on low for 4 hours and they came out perfect! Tender and tasty!
Delicious! I added some chopped sweet peppers to the crockpot and served over rice, it was a hit will the whole family 😋

I didn't think I was going to like it because I don't care for soy sauce, but I was pleasantly surprised. I used low-sodium soy sauce. I threw in some sweet potato too. In my slow cooker (which is from the 70s) it was ready in only 2 hours on high. The chicken fell off the bone. Next time, I'll cook with more chicken and potato for more leftovers because there is plenty of sauce. I had it with nuked frozen vegetables.
Perfect paired with rice or veggies and makes meal prepping so easy.
I made 10 chicken thighs , there was plenty of sauce . Made mashed potatoes and broccoli. Very yummy !

Winner, Winner, crock pot dinner! Hands down one of the easiest flavorful meals you can make. The chicken falls of the bone and the sauce it makes is sticky sweet. I serve it with herbed rice made with basil, parsley and oregano. Delicious!
Absolutely fabulous! So simple and delicious, I didn't make any changes to the recipe. This is going in the "Favorites" folder!!
Chicken was dry and did not care for the flavor of it. This is not a keeper for me.
Very easy and tasty. I added 1/4 cup packed brown sugar and Sriracha. Had plenty of sauce. I cooked potatoes with meat. Would have been good with pasta and white rice as well.
I've been making this for quite a while, my family loves it.
can double the chicken and still have plenty of sauce
I switched the basil for ground ginger but this makes a very good dish
Delicious.. add white rice and cilantro salsa!
I didn’t have enough ketchup on hand so used half ketchup and half sweet chilli sauce. Husband loved it and so did I. Easy and tasty dish. Thank you 😊
It was really good my family loved it.I will make it again.
Followed the recipe. The chicken was dry and the sauce tasted burnt. Would not make this again.

This was great, my husband loved it even though he normally doesn't favor dark meat chicken. He said this recipe was a keeper! It's easy, but 6 hrs. on low a bit much, turned it to warm after 5 hrs. Was tender, juicy.

Way too dry and tough, 6 hours in a slow cooker is way too much time for a few chicken thighs. Flavor was good. I would suggest trying this recipe using a instapot or other pressure cooker, it would be much, much better

I made this, but I baked it in the oven at 350 for about one hour and a half hours depending on how much chicken I've used. Put the chicken in a glass baking dish. Dip the chicken in the mix, pour remaining mix over the chicken. Bake for one hour Turn chicken thighs over, and spoon the sauce back over the top. Then bake for approx one half hour more. I also adjusted the ingredients down to about one half of the quantity listed, and added liquid smoke to the mixture. Best chicken ever! Super simple and very moist! Can't wait to make it again! Wife loved it!
FOUR boneless chicken thighs in the crockpot???? What’s the point?

I made this and increased it by half. 6 thighs, and half again with all the ingredients, ( I have a big family). I served it over angel hair pasta and incredibly EVERYONE loved it! We had left over pasta and the next day I threw some frozen veggies and the left over pasta in the wok and the kids loved it again for a meatless dinner.
i made it a little dry accidently but made a chicken salad with it. still delicious.
Was so easy and so delicious!! A family hit!
I added a little more honey then I added fresh grated ginger. It was great.
The flavor was fine but 6h was WAYYYYY too long for 4 thighs; the meat was incredibly dry.
Delicious! Used chicken thighs with bones and skin. Turned out great. (We were worried it would be too greasy, but it was not.) I will make this again. We served it with Zataran's Dirty Rice.
Recipe was easy to follow. Six hours on low was too long to cook! Four hours might have been about right. Chicken came out dry. I used half ketchup and BBQ sauce. Flavor was great!

Awesome! I added lots of spices - including red pepper flakes and cayenne, onion powder and several other varied spices. It was amazing. Cooked a little too long but that was on me and it was still amazing!
Such an easy recipe to taste so delicious! Will make this again. We served over shirataki noodles, spaghetti style and loved it.

Adjusted the recipe for 6 people. Maybe I did something wrong, but we did not like it at all. I just low sodium soy sauce and it was a total salt bomb! Besides that we just didn't like the flavor. Won't be using this recipe again
It was okay. Made it with rice and frozen stir fry veggies. I added a little finger for taste

My family and I literally inhaled this for dinner. Yummo! I flung in 12 thighs and doubled the sauce but definitely didn't need to. Though the extra sauce is always good to mop up with crusty buttered bread! I coated the thighs first with garlic and onion powder, S&P, and paprika, then seared them before placing in slow cooker. I didn't read the reviews here until after I'd put it on, so I was stressing all afternoon about it being "too salty", *needlessly*. I didn't find it too salty at all (I was, however, heavy handed with the honey! ). I also added cornstarch to thicken. I'd definitely cook this again, so easy and tasty.
Made this easy recipe with chicken breasts and it is soooo good!!! Husband loved it too!
Added half diced onion, garlic, red pepper flakes, some ginger powder, basil
Make 1/2 the marinade - it will be more than enough! Also, I subbed maple syrup for the honey.
Topped it with toasted sesame seeds and doubled the sauce, thickened it with corn starch and used the sauce over brown rice and served sauteed veggies with it.

First off, I am not one to leave reviews on really anything BUT THIS!!!! I’ve tried many online recipes for chicken thighs and this is without a doubt the BEST!! So delicious. I was pretty skeptical to try it once I saw a few “Too salty” reviews because I hate anything salty but it turned out phenomenal!! Will definitely be making this again in the future!
Its my go-to dinner for my 16 year old! He loves it!

I am crazy about this chicken as are my daughter, SIL, and granddaughter (a picky 17 y.o.). But I also had a relative suggest that when I make it, that I use a bit less soy sauce and a bit more honey so I used 1/4 c. soy and a 1/2 c. honey which worked beautifully and gave distinctive notes of honey and soy at a balance that I thought was perfect. . .if you think about it--the soy basically provides the slightly salty note. would recommend the recipe as written or maybe change a bit the way I did. I know this is quirky but I always ALWAYS prepare and freeze chicken as soon as I process it from store. Earlier recipes that I tried after retiring the chicken tended to dry out a bit but now is less dry and more flavorful. Bon Appetit.

I thought this recipe was fantastic. Especially since it's soooo easy. My fiance thought it was magic too. I tried it exactly as directed the first time around, with chicken thighs and all. Tonight I'm trying it with chicken breasts as other reviewers have raved about. Can't wait to see how this cut turns out! ^_^
It’s a basic tasting recipe. Next time I make it I will add onions and freshly graded ginger to kick up the taste.
yummmmmmy!

The sauce on this dish is AMAZING! The chicken was so tender and delicious. Yesterday I decided to make the sauce and put it over baby back ribs. I placed the ribs on heavy duty foil, poured the sauce over the ribs, topped with more foil and crimped the foil tightly all around the ribs. Baked at 300 degrees for 3 hours. Turned the oven off and allowed the meat to rest for 30 minutes or so before serving. Some of the best ribs I've ever prepared. I will keep this sauce in the fridge for all types of meat - not just chicken.

Great taste with so few ingredients. Quick and so easy. Will definitely make again....soon! Used low sodium soy sauce. Next time will add some fresh ginger and sesame seeds and a splash of Sesame seed oil during the last hour. Added corn starch at the end (to avoid the cornstarch just curdling up in the warm sauce, you put about 1 tablespoons of corn starch in approximately 1/2 cup of water and whisk well. Then adding a small amount at a time of the hot sauce to the cold mixture. When mixture is more warm than cold, you then add it into the sauce. You could increase the thickening effect even more by moving the sauce to a pan and bringing it to a boil.)
Tasted like soy sauce. Couldn't taste the garlic or honey. Won't make it again.

This turned out really good! I made it exactly as described, except I added red ppeper flakes and I accidentally bought bone-in chicken thighs with skin. I think it would have been better with boneless/skinless. But, the flavor of the marinade was really great, especially for something so easy. Will definitely be making again.
Good flavor but the skin made the sauce oily. I knew better but was lazy. Great recipe for a quick prepped meal
As suggested, I added red pepper flakes and ginger. A keeper! My family loved it, but cooking on high for 4 hours was more than enough to make the meat fall off the bones! ~H. Boyer

This is a simple and delicious recipe that I have made often and served over Basmati rice, typically with sauteed green beans. Yum! As of late, I have been first putting a large chopped onion and 3-4 medium sliced carrots in the bottom of the slow cooker, then the chicken, (I tend to use 2-3 breasts cut in 5-6 pieces each). In this case, I double the sauce ingredients (for the ketchup, I put 1\2 ketchup and 1/2 Heinz chili sauce for a little kick) and add some chili pepper flakes. The family always enjoys it! Today I took an extra step to first season my chicken pieces with salt and pepper and brown them in a frying pan with a Tbsp of olive oil. I'm looking forward to seeing how this turns out!
Cooked as instructed. Extremely salty and way overcooked.
Delicious! I stirfyed veggies and rice and added it in. So yummy!

I made this recipe exactly as written. It smelled so good when it was cooking, but I was disappointed with the texture of the chicken when I tried it. I think this sauce would do better as a glaze for baked/oven-barbequed chicken--just cook it down a bit so it is thicker. I think I might add a few green onions to it as well.
We all hated this dish. I made it exactly as it’s written. Had it over rice. It was gross. The flavor was terrible. We threw it away.
I doubled the thigh quantity, used low-sodium Soy Sauce and they still came out full of flavor.

I see a lot of people commenting on how this recipe is "too salty"; neither I or my husband have a salt sensitivity (nor any health issues re: sodium), I just thought it was too much liquid. So, I used 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup "hot" honey, 1/4 cup tomato "paste" (instead of ketchup) and 1/4 cup orange juice. I also added 1 small onion & a dash of fresh grated ginger. Turned out great! not too sweet (or too salty) - just right. Garnished with scallions and cilantro. Served with wild rice.
This was very good and super easy. I did not add as much honey because I don’t like things to sweet and I added some siracha at the end. Great recipe!
Super easy and delicious. I would make it again
Made this for my husband for dinner. Neither of us cared for it. I made it according to the recipe and thickened the sauce as suggested. We just didn’t care for the sauce flavor.

I cannot for the life of me wrap my head around the number of positive reviews for this. I’ve always known you don’t slow cook chicken. I was dizzy thinking this would somehow be an exception. “Slow and low” is for beef and pork. Chicken doesn’t break down like beef does. It becomes tasty, ketchup flavored, dried out shoe leather. If you are trying to find a recipe to impress company or something …… run. Run, and do not turn back.
My husband forgot to turn on the crockpot so I had to adjust time by 2hrs. He called me and said it smelled so good. It was excellent he even saved the extra sauce from the bottom of the pot
I added less soy sauce than it called for and the salty fumes from my crock pot was unbearable. It came out so dry and salty.

Well, I'm brain dead. Thawed skinless breasts. Deboned them myself. Had some Chinese 5 spice hanging around. Added 1/2 tsp to original sauce. Cooked in no time. Thickened sauce with corn starch. Plan to serve it with parsley ed pasta. Garnish with green onions. No tasters yet except me, but I loved it.

As a single guy I was able to get two meals from this very tasty recipe. Admittedly, I am a fan of salt … Followed the ingredient amounts and mixing as per recipe. Used small size slow cooker, lined bottom of cooker with small amount of prepared sauce then placed thighs on top.
Kept skin on/put small amount of sauce under skin then poured remainder over all.
6 hours on low (never opened). Sauce wasn’t thick, more “thickesh”. Chicken was very tasty and fall off bone tender.
Really enjoyed it.
What a waste of money, 6 hours is way too long to cook, the flavors were great but the chicken was so dry
too salty for my taste. I should have used low salt soy salt as others had mentioned, but used what I had on hand.
Too salty … could of left out the honey and the garlic cause you couldn’t taste either!

This is very good! I had only bone-in chicken thighs. I also added one tsp. of liquid smoke to the recipe. One reviewer suggested using fresh ginger. Yum! There is so much more you could do with this. Thank you for this recipe!
Easy, yummy. Hubs loved it!
This chicken is awesome. Everyone I serve it to asks for the recipe! Thanks for posting it.

Fast and easy. I doubled the chicken and still had enough sauce. I set on low for about three hours and then put on high for the last half an hour to make sure that the sauce dried up. I didn't find it salty but I did put a tad extra honey in and a little less soy sauce.
So easy and delicious. I added chili garlic paste and it gave it a little extra heat.
The flavor was off and not good like other honey garlic chicken I’ve made in the past. Would not recommend making this.

I used six thighs that had skin and bones, because that’s what I had in my freezer. I didn’t increase the sauce ingredients, but there was still plenty of sauce. Because we don’t like garlic, I used one teaspoon of garlic powder instead of what the recipe called for. I also added a sprinkle of red pepper flakes. I put the chicken in frozen on Low at about 11:15, and by 6 pm it was coming off the bones. After the chicken was done, I spooned most of the liquid into a small saucepan, added some cornstarch mixed with water, and heated and stoppered it until it was thickened, and we spooned that over the chicken and rice. We loved it!
Loved it! So easy to make. One of my favorites

This recipe has All The Things. Quick, easy, ingredients aren't exotic -- and man oh man do my children love it. The way I make it is by breading/flouring the chicken thighs (using either flour or a panko/flour mix), and sauteeing in olive oil till golden. I mix up the sauce while this is going on, then put the thighs into the slow cooker (making sure sauce covers everything) at low for 4-6 hours OR into my casserole dish for 1 hour at 350. So tender and delicious either way!
I substitute barbeque sauce for ketchup and use coconut aminos in place of soy sauce. I cook for only 2.5 hours and check doneness with a thermometer.
The chicken comes out so tasty and this is the easiest recipe ever.
